name: Child's Pose
how_to_perform:
1. Kneel on the mat with your knees wide apart and your hips directly above your heels.
2. Lengthen your torso and slowly lower your forehead to the ground, keeping your shoulders relaxed.
3. Keep your arms outstretched in front of you, palms facing downwards, as you rest your body in this position.
4. Engage your core muscles by drawing your belly button towards your spine and keep your pelvic floor engaged to support your back.
5. Breathe slowly and deeply, feeling the stretch in your lower back, glutes, hips, and calves.
short_summary: Child's Pose is a foundational yoga stretching movement that targets the entire posterior muscle chain in a resting position
